text:
Had a hugely informative week at the #EGU23 conference

The highlight for me was the incredibly powerful talk by @WimThiery on his award-winning paper comparing the lifetime exposure to weather extremes and impacts for today‚Äôs kids vs older generations. Hard-hitting science ‚§µÔ∏è ¬´ WimThiery: The kids aren't alright

In our new paper in @ScienceMagazine and acompanying @save_children report, we uncover the strong intergenerational inequities in exposure to climate extremes üßµ 1/n
Report: https://resourcecentre.savethechildren.net/document/born-climate-crisis-why-we-must-act-now-secure-childrens-rights/
Paper: http://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.abi7339 ‚Äî https://twitter.com/wimthiery/status/1442409556034740230 ¬ª
user_description: Climate scientist, Met Office, Exeter Uni. IPCC lead author. 3rd UK Climate Change Risk Assessment Technical Lead. MBE. Mastodon @richardabetts@universeodon.com
